intro: Phyllorkis kingii, commonly known as the King's phyllorkis, is a species of flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in sandy or rocky habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
